Dear Ms. Hill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: Facility has not submitted adoption records to MDHHS for
permanent retention one year following the final order of adoption as required.
INVESTIGATION:
The complainant reported the agency had not submitted the adoption records to the
Michigan Department of Social Services within 1 year of the adoption finalization as
required.
I requested documentation from Complainant on 05/23/2022 to identify what adoption
records have not been submitted. The information was received from Complainant on
05/23/2022. The information received indicated there were two adoption records from
2

this agency that had not been submitted as required. The identified dates of adoption
for these two cases were 10/06/2020 and 11/06/2020 respectively.
I left a voice mail message for Administrator 1 on 05/23/2022 regarding the initiation of
the special investigation. I interviewed Administrator 1 at the agency on 05/24/2022.
Administrator 1 acknowledged the agency had not submitted the adoption records
within the time frame required. Administrator 1 reported the agency is currently initiating
a new tracking system to establish and maintain compliance. Administrator 1 provided
documentation the two records associated with this investigation were received by
MDHHS on 04/18/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the agency had not
submitted two adoption records to MDHHS within the 1-year
time period required by this rule. The agency is in the process
of implementing a new tracking system to establish and
maintain compliance with this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child placing agency-private be maintained.
